page.title: 05The Pottery
page.content: Mr.J.Hermanson has owned the pottery for about ten years. He started there on his own and now employs twelve other people. They work for eight hours a day from 8.30am until 5.30pm with an hour for lunch break.The pottery uses about 5 tons of clay a week.The day is brought by lorry from Stoke-on-Trent where it is processed. Approximately 720 pots are made each week in various shapes and sizes.Most are made in moulds using tools called profiles to shape the pots.The kilns take 200 pots at a time and when glazing is taking place about 350 are done at a time.The pots are coloured iron,honey, oatmeal and nutmeg.The workers are all local people who have gained experience as they have worked there.Packers sometimes work in the evening and a new store warehouse has been opened but expansion is expected.
